members.member: This is the suffix that we add to the %appdata% variable to construct the directory location where we're persisting our local xml file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.RegisteredServers.RegisteredServersStore.ExceptionDelegates
member.summary: Delegate member to hold the list of delegate handlers

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.RegisteredServers.RegisteredServersStore.#ctor
member.summary: This constructor is purely a place holder to allow the serialize to construct this object and set other properties on it. This constructor will not be used for directly connecting to the local store. Instead we will use a static method to initialize the store from the XML file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.RegisteredServers.RegisteredServersStore.#ctor(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ServerConnection)
member.summary: This constructor is used for a Store that represents storage in a SQL server instead of a file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.RegisteredServers.RegisteredServersStore.ReloadLocalFileStore
member.summary: Discard the current local file store and reload it from disk
member.remarks: This isn't called "Refresh" because SfcInstance.Refresh does something completely different, like populating property bags, validating connections, etc. Also, this method is just reloading the local file store. Any non-local storage is unaffected by the method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.RegisteredServers.RegisteredServersStore.InitializeLocalRegisteredServersStore
member.summary: Initializes the store from the default configuration file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.RegisteredServers.RegisteredServersStore.MigrateLocalXmlFileFromLegacySSMS(System.String)
member.summary: Migrate the RegServer Store file from older versions of SSMS (17.x and earlier) - Try to deserialize older files that may be on the machine (e.g. installed by older versions of SSMS) - If the deserialization succeeds, then copy that file to the current location Note: starting with SSMS 18.0, the location is not versioned anymore.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.RegisteredServers.RegisteredServersStore.TryDeserializeLocalXmlFile(System.String,Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.RegisteredServers.RegisteredServersStore@,System.Exception@)
member.summary: Tries to deserialize Local XML file.
member.param: The full path to the file we are trying to deserialize
The object that represents the deserialized file
The exception that was caught (if any); if no exception happened and the deserialization was successful, this is set to null
member.returns: True if the file existed and could be deserialized; false otherwise

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.RegisteredServers.RegisteredServersStore.InitChildObjects(System.String)
member.summary: Helper function that inits the root's child objects from a file
